front.title: Network-Hexagons:Geolocation Mobility Network Based On H3 and LISP

abstract.t: This specification describes the use of Locator/ID SeparationProtocol (LISP) for network virtualization overlays (NVO) and network function distribution (NFD) to enable a mobility network overlay with distributed geolocation functions. The distributed geolocation functions are anchored by logically addressed geolocation agents. Geolocation agents endpoint identifiers (EID) determined according to the H3 hierarchical hexagonal grid area they cover. Geolocation agents consolidate, delegate, and propagate information and logic to in-vehicle agents, whose EIDs are ephemeral to protect the geo- privacy of the vehicle owner. In-vehicle EIDs are obtained-renewed through authorization, authentication, accounting procedure(AAA). The primary function supported by this specification is dynamic mapping using in-vehicle agents in a distributed manner while driving. Secondary distributed compute functions can use the same network.
